result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and Operating w/ PAC (4th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • Ted L Rodriguez was found guilty of OWI (4th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $3014.00 - To be paid during period of probation.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Obtain and maintain full-time employment and/or vocational training.
It is a condition of probation that the defendant  NOT consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances. Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety.

Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.  
Do not drive unless properly licensed.  
Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law.
Alcohol/drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. Random UA's at discretion of agent.

***AMENDED 09-09-2015; TO ALLOW DEFENDANT TO DO VOLUNTEER WORK FROM 1-4 P.M...1 DAY PER WEEK @ (RACINE AREA CENTRAL OFFICE)..RACO.***Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: ***MODIFIED 7/15/15 TO ALLOW DEFENDANT TO GO FOR TREATMENT IF THERE IS VERIFICATION***  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any  alcohol.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.  The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Defendant is ordered to have SCRAM unit installed and monitored by Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) - 524 S. Main Street, 3rd floor (262-632-1780.  $208 advanced fee for installment of SCRAM must be paid prior to release from jail.    Defendant to be placed on GPS monitor through Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI), 524 Main Street, 3rd floor, (262-632-1780).  House arrest - exception is going for medical treatment.  Defendant must live with father.   Do not drive unless properly licensed.   Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.  This case has been assigned to Judge Constantine, Branch 7.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 10-14-2015 01:30 pm

BTC:  Mod bond to allow defendant to do volunteer work from 1-4 pm.  1 day per day @ RACO
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 14, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
